data.title: Windows 8 Surface (ARM) crash
data.body:
Hey All! Big thanks to MonoGame Team for you work.
Today I meet some arm crash for (x86 all work perfectly) in sampler state creation, any ideas.

SharpDX.SharpDXException was unhandled
  HResult=-2147024809
  Message=HRESULT: [0x80070057], Module: [Unknown], ApiCode: [Unknown/Unknown], Message: The parameter is incorrect.

  Source=SharpDX
  StackTrace:
       at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
       at SharpDX.Direct3D11.Device.CreateSamplerState(SamplerStateDescription& samplerDescRef, SamplerState samplerStateOut)
       at SharpDX.Direct3D11.SamplerState..ctor(Device device, SamplerStateDescription& description)
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SamplerState.GetState(GraphicsDevice device) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\States\SamplerState.cs:line 198
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SamplerStateCollection.SetSamplers(GraphicsDevice device) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SamplerStateCollection.cs:line 136
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.ApplyState(Boolean applyShaders) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.cs:line 2070
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.DrawUserIndexedPrimitives[T](PrimitiveType primitiveType, T[] vertexData, Int32 vertexOffset, Int32 numVertices, Int16[] indexData, Int32 indexOffset, Int32 primitiveCount, VertexDeclaration vertexDeclaration) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.cs:line 2324
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatcher.FlushVertexArray(Int32 start, Int32 end) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs:line 287
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatcher.DrawBatch(SpriteSortMode sortMode) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs:line 267
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.DrawInternal(Texture2D texture, Vector4 destinationRectangle, Nullable`1 sourceRectangle, Color color, Single rotation, Vector2 origin, SpriteEffects effect, Single depth) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatch.cs:line 293
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.Draw(Texture2D texture, Rectangle destinationRectangle, Nullable`1 sourceRectangle, Color color, Single rotation, Vector2 origin, SpriteEffects effect, Single depth) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatch.cs:line 227
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.Draw(Texture2D texture, Rectangle destinationRectangle, Nullable`1 sourceRectangle, Color color) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatch.cs:line 303
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.Draw(Texture2D texture, Rectangle rectangle, Color color) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SpriteBatch.cs:line 313
       at MonoMahjongg.Source.MonoMahjongg.Draw(GameTime gameTime) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameProjects\MonoMahjongg\Source\MonoMahjongg.cs:line 118
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw(GameTime gameTime) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Game.cs:line 688
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick() in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Game.cs:line 525
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MetroGameWindow.Tick() in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Windows8\MetroGameWindow.cs:line 310
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MetroGamePlatform.<StartRunLoop>b__0(Object o, Object a) in d:\MonoGame\MonoGameSources\MonoGame.Framework\Windows8\MetroGamePlatform.cs:line 178
  InnerException: 

PS: Sorry for bad English

data.title: Initial check in of Core "Split" Project
data.body:
- Windows Project implementation only
- Added PCL Targets Foder with PCL target libs and instructions
- All files unchanged except for:
  -  additional #if statements for core project
  -  patch to Content/ContentTypeReaderManager.cs to allow for core type resolution
- Single solution files for Windows VS and Xamarin Studio

data.title: Handle to Device property for GraphicsDevice.
data.body: This small change gives developers on microsoft platforms new hard layer of developing by adding possibility of using directx calls from SharpDX Device(eg for implementing missing features like compute shaders). The XNA does not have this feature, but why not extending programmers life by this small change ? The other platforms will not be wound.

data.title: Implement left-side overhang compensation for SpriteFont (#1355)
data.body: This fixes the bug reported in issue #1355, where characters overhanging on their left side don't work correctly.

data.title: Fix RenderTarget2D on PlayStation Mobile
data.body: The current implementation of render targets on PlayStation Mobile doesn't actually work. This PR provides a working implementation for 2D render targets. Other types are probably still broken.

data.title: Steps towards a working PlayStation Mobile implementation of Effect
data.body:
These are the commits I've made to get Effect closer to working on PlayStation Mobile. I am pretty sure they break BasicEffect, but I can't be sure, because it's next to impossible to get any of the samples to run on PSM for me, either against trunk or against my branch.

These changes (along with the other changes from my branch) were sufficient, however, to port my XNA Effect-based rendering stack over to PSM with only minor changes, so I think they're an improvement. It should be possible to make BasicEffect work again if someone can point me towards a sample that uses it and should work on PSM.

data.title: Expand PlayStation Mobile graphics API support
data.body: It looks like RenderTarget2D and BlendState have diverged tremendously since I branched off, but I was able to extract out a bunch of my other rendering API changes. The commit messages should be self-explanatory.

data.title: PlayStation Mobile input fixes
data.body:
Here are some simple fixes for input on PlayStation Mobile:

IsButton(Up|Down) weren't working for some of the thumbstick enumerations, so I implemented them.

The Y axis of the analog sticks was inverted, so I compensated for that.

In a recent SDK update they silently broke it such that the input APIs (for getting gamepad state, etc) will crash with a cryptic exception. I added code to detect this and rethrow it wrapped with a meaningful message so that the developer will know how to fix it.

data.title: Split project into Core (suitable for all platforms) and platform specific projects
data.body:
Continuing from https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1583

Thanks for your comments @tomspilman , in response:

1 - Having separate folders for project - This is not what we wanted or expected. I don't think having one folder per-platform is clean up or will simplify management in any way.
 Fair enough this just seemed to make sense but if you don't like it (as I did with @slygamer 's comments I can change it. It's not a big thing, just moving the .csproj files which are currently the only files in those folders back into their original location

2: Build folders in central location
 Again if you feel this is a step too far, I can roll it back not a big deal

3: with regards to the effect files these are NOT new, they were effect resource files which were located in the PSM folder, every other project has them in one location so it was simply tidied up. Again if you feel this is a separate PR to the core split they can be left back where they were.

4: DataCOntract usage on other platforms, since the files using these are now using those classes from the PCL, it's the PCL that supports DataContract and not the platform. In all the platforms I could test on both in MonoGame and other projects this has never caused an issue.

 *Note only DataContract is supported in a PCL, serialisable is not.
 Again if you feel this is a step too far we can strip out all of those classes from core too.

5: Assembly naming. before I make any further changes there can we agree on which assembly is going to get called what. Is the core going to be called "MonoGame.Framework" or "MonoGame.Framework.Core" and what about the project libs. Can we get a consensus from the core group before I change it again.

As i've said all along to @tomspilman and @dellis1972 , I have no agenda here other than to help

As for the Branch I was committing from, I think this was just a misunderstanding on my part from the instructions Tom, I was under the belief I had to merge changes in my own development branch and then merge with develop before submitting the pull request on my develop branch. I see now this was incorrect and will drop this pull request and resubmit a new one once the above clarifications have been worked out.

Up to you guys, if you want one solution split and submitted with the agreed assembly naming, or all the projects that i've already split. Leaving the others later may cause issue as several commits have been pushed in to develop that changes the landscape of each of the projects that have to be reanalysed each time to check what is core and what is project.

I'll be sure to make more discrete changes in the future beyond the split

data.title: First pass at implementing GetData for PSM.
data.body: Works for me here, but may need further tweaks for others.

data.title: Current Song dispose was throwing exception, due to multiple disposes.
data.body: Changed to handle disposing the Song object more gracefully.

data.title: Add missing GameUpdateRequiredException reference.
MGCB fails to build `.spritefont` files on non-Windows platforms
data.body:
While playing around with the MGCB tool, I found that it can successfully convert images to XNB (to be loaded as `Texture2D`'s). However, I tried the same thing with a test `.spritefont` file, which always fails on any non-Windows platform (or at least Mac OS).

After some source code spelunking, I found that the reason is that the file [`MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/FontHelper.cs`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/FontHelper.cs#L20-L29) is coupled to Windows, through `gdi32.dll` (which is unavailable within Mono). Are there any plans to remove this DLL dependency (or at least swap it out for the cross-platform `libgdi.dll`)? I sifted through a few Mono API docs, but I didn't spot any equivalent functions.

data.title: iOS TitleContainer Tests For Retina Display in CTOR
data.body: Recent Xamarin.iOS as of March 28th 2013 does not allow background sounds to play. I get a check exception on the process trying to run something (load from stream) that must run on the UI thread. I will try to capture the exception again.

data.title: Added Tests to default.build script
Added methods to get all processors and importers
data.body: Added some helper methods. It's useful for MonoDevelop/XamarinStudio Addins

data.title: SaveAsPng on WinRT doesn't save an alpha
data.body:
Texture2D / RenderTarget2D.SaveAsPng doesn't save an alpha on WinRT. The transparent pixels are saved black.

In internal MonoGame's method Texture2D.SaveAsImage is written:
// TODO: We need to convert from Format to R8G8B8A8!

I want to save my rendertarget to file + load it back to XAML (as Image.Source).

data.title: Fix for iOS not calling OnOrientationChanged.
iOS does not call Window.OnOrientationChanged
data.body: I checked and iOS does not seems to call this method like it should. I think it is not calling it on Android also. I'll try to make a fix for this.

data.title: Cant compile shader "unexpected token"
Cant compile shader
Create separation/function classes for platform bespoke functions
data.body:
While doing the core split, one practice which did cause a lot of issue (and prevented a large portion of the codebase from moving into the core project) where to do with platform specific functions that were copied throughout the codebase.

The areas of most concern were to do with the likes of:
- File-IO
- Disk access
- Reflection
- etc

These should be their own helper/etension classes which are consumed by the rest of the code base and maintaining a single stream of code for all platforms seperated with #if statements as they are now.

This would help centralise what the implementation is for these functions and remove a lot of "copy" code currently spread around the codebase.

data.title: MonoGame Team showcase sample/game
data.body:
I've mentioned this to @dellis1972 in the past, but don't think I've mentioned it to anyone else.

I think we should have a couple of samples/games that we release on all platforms that are used to purely showcase the multi-platform ness of MonoGame. These would be free with advertising, and any money raised through these adverts would go towards the MonoGame donations. We do have a showcase section on the new site, but they are not from the team as such. I hope that makes sense.

My initial thoughts were a 2D and a 3D game, maybe the same game but evolved, of what type I had not decided, only they should be simple, be visually appealing (hmm eye candy) and hopefully fun :) ( what everyone wants )

Thoughts?

D.

data.title: SpriteBatch have limits ??.
Ouya pause button support
data.body: Ouya system button sends Keycode.Menu after a delay if no double tap or hold is detected. It also sends Keycode.Home just before the system menu is opened (but not on dev kit controllers): http://forums.ouya.tv/discussion/comment/6076/#Comment_6076

data.title: Suggestion: Add basic shape primitives for quick and easy prototyping
Split project into Core (suitable for all platforms) and platform specific projects
data.body:
Updated split solution to separate "Core" files from project files
Created separate solutions for all platforms based on latest commits using new "Core" PCL project (tested in Xamarin Studio and VS)

Created two singular projects
- VS project with all VS supported projects (based on Xamarin FREE install)
- Xamarin project for all Xamarin Free supported projects.

Tested and built all projects with sample solutions to resolve any split project issues (only known issue was with type resolution in content loading - resolved)

Will work on updating "Portable" solution post update

data.title: Fix Content Pipeline build errors on OS X
data.body:
While trying to get the MGCB tool to compile on OS X, I saw that the `MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.MacOS` project was giving out errors. After some spelunking, I found that some DLL's and class files were left out of the project. This fixes that.

I don't have a Linux distro setup to test right now, but I believe the same issue carries over with their equivalent project as well.

data.title: This fixes the missing content loader exception for a null AV player
data.body: This is just the missing content loader exception. The reason for the null AV player is unknown yet.

data.title: Ouya - Gamepad buttons lag
data.body:
When you push the buttons on the gamepad too fast or basically mash the buttons the input queue appears to lag out and take sometime to clear out.

this is a known issue with the api and there is a workaround for it.
it involves overriding one of the api functions.

here is the thread for the workaround
http://forums.ouya.tv/discussion/488/controller-lag-and-inaccuracy/p1

i donno if this can be done, but i was thinking that something like this can be done in the api binding.
